document.docTitle: Homoneura (Homoneura) apicomata Shi & Yang, 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Notes on the Homoneura (Homoneura) beckeri group from the Oriental Region, with descriptions of ten new species from China (Diptera: Lauxaniidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on the Homoneura (Homoneura) beckeri group from the Oriental Region, with descriptions of ten new species from China (Diptera: Lauxaniidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Face pale yellow without spot, inner margin of parafacial black on ventral 1 / 2 . Antenna brownish black except 1 st flagellomere pale yellow on ventral 1 / 3 – 1 / 2 . Wing with a narrow brown stripe on dm-cu . Abdomen yellow, tergite 2 with two blackish brown lateral bands; tergites 3–5 each with a blackish brown posterior band, and an indistinct triangular median spot confluent with the blackish brown posterior band; tergite 6 without spot.
Description. MALE. Body length 3.2–3.7 mm , wing length 2.8–3.1 mm . FEMALE. Body length 3.3–4.3 mm , wing length 3.1–3.9 mm .

Head pale yellow. Face pale yellow without spot, inner margin of parafacial black on ventral 1 / 2 . Frons about as long as wide and parallel–sided, with two narrow brownish gray stripes along or rows and a narrow brown triangular median stripe, extending to ocellar triangle; ocellar triangle grayish black; oc strong, shorter than anterior or , anterior or slightly shorter than posterior or . Gena about 1 / 6 height of eye. Occiput with a wide grayish black stripe, confluent with ocellar triangle. Antenna brownish black except 1 st flagellomere pale yellow on ventral 1 / 3 – 1 /2, 1st flagellomere 2.0 times longer than high; arista long plumose, black except brownish base, with longest hairs longer than height of 1 st flagellomere. Proboscis brownish yellow, with yellowish and blackish hairs; palpus pale yellow with blackish hairs.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype 3 ( CAUC ), CHINA , Hainan Province : Baisha, Yinggeling National Nature Reserve, Hongmao village ( 430 m ),
21 . V. 2007
, Kuiyan Zhang. Paratypes : CHINA , Hainan Province : 1 3 ( CAUC ), Wuzhishan National Nature Reserve, Guanshantai ( 600 m ),
16 . V. 2007
, Junhua Zhang; 1 3, 1 Ƥ ( CAUC ), Wuzhishan National Nature Reserve, Guanshantai ( 600 m ),
16 . V. 2007
, Kuiyan Zhang; 1 Ƥ ( CAUC ), Wuzhishan City, Wuzhishan ( 600 m ),
17 . V. 2007
, Junhua Zhang; 1 3, 1 Ƥ ( CAUC ), Baisha, Yinggeling National Nature Reserve, Hongxin village ( 430 m ),
11 . IX. 2008
, Shan Huo; 1 Ƥ ( CAUC ), Baisha, Yinggeling National Nature Reserve, Hongmao village ( 430 m ),
20 . V. 2007
, Junhua Zhang; 1 Ƥ ( CAUC ), Baisha, Yinggeling National Nature Reserve, Hongmao village ( 430 m ),
18 . X. 2007
, Xingyue Liu.

Remarks. The new species is somewhat similar to
Homoneura ( Homoneura ) fasciventris Malloch
from China in the following characters: face pale yellow without spot, wing with a pale brown elliptical spot on dmcu , gonopod columniform. But it can be separated from the latter by the antennal 1 st flagellomere being black; the hypandrium having a pair of short bar–like ventral processes, the hypandrial apodeme being indistinct; the surstylus being narrow, incurved and stick–like; the aedeagus having a pair of dorsoapical teeth. In
H . ( H .) fasciventris
, the antennal 1 st flagelomere is yellow except dark at the tip, the hypandrium has no short bar– like ventral process, the hypandrial apodeme is distinct; the surstylus is claw–like, and the aedeagus has a pair of triangular ventral sclerites, projecting laterally, and a pair of subulifom dorsal processes (
Sasakawa 1992
).
Etymology. Latin, api- , prefix meaning apical + comata , meaning hairy, referring to the epandrium having a row of apical hairs; a feminine adjective.
